context: Blackbaud, Inc. is a software for nonprofits and social good organizations focused on fundraising, CRM, financial management, and analytics for nonprofits. Cloud migration accelerating. Acquired multiple nonprofit tech companies.

competitors.name: Salesforce (Nonprofit Success Pack)
competitors.notes: Major competitor with customizable CRM adapted for nonprofits, offering free licenses for up to 10 users

competitors.name: DonorPerfect
competitors.notes: Established donor management software provider with growing cloud-based fundraising platform

competitors.name: Convio (later acquired by Blackbaud in 2012)
competitors.notes: Leading online marketing and fundraising software for nonprofits, strong in digital engagement

competitors.name: CiviCRM
competitors.notes: Mature open source CRM for nonprofits offering free alternative to proprietary systems, translated into 30+ languages

competitors.name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM
competitors.notes: Enterprise CRM being adapted for nonprofit use with fundraising and donor management customizations

competitors.name: Salsa Labs
competitors.notes: Online fundraising, advocacy, and email marketing platform for nonprofits and advocacy organizations

competitors.name: DonorSnap
competitors.notes: Web-based donor management and fundraising software for small to mid-size nonprofits

competitors.name: eTapestry (owned by Blackbaud)
competitors.notes: Cloud-based donor management system acquired by Blackbaud, targeting smaller nonprofits

competitors.name: Network for Good
competitors.notes: Online fundraising and donor management platform focused on small nonprofits
